title: ZK I Zettel 1,5B2b - Niklas Luhmann-Archiv
body: 1,5B2b Anders als bei Hobbes fordert die Vernunft desMenschen hier nicht einen möglichst effektiven Staatschlechthin, sondern nur einen Staat, der die Befugnisse hat(Rechtsform: trust), die er braucht, um das Eigentum seinerBürger wirksam zu schützen. Vgl. § 131: "But though men when they enter into society give upthe equality, liberty, and executive power they had inthe state of nature into the hands of the society, to be sofar disposed of by the legislative as the good of thesociety shall require; yet it being only with anintention in every one the better to preserve himself,his liberty, and his property (for no rational creaturecan be supposed to extend change his condition with anintention to be worse), the power of the society, or
